Job Title: SITEC 3 EOM Enterprise Operations and Infrastructure Technical Lead

Location: Tampa, Florida, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Other

Description:
About Peraton

Peraton is a next-generation national security company that drives missions of consequence spanning the globe and extending to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. As the world's leading mission capability integrator and transformative enterprise IT provider, we deliver trusted, highly differentiated solutions and technologies to protect our nation and allies. Peraton operates at the critical nexus between traditional and nontraditional threats across all domains: land, sea, space, air, and cyberspace. The company serves as a valued partner to essential government agencies and supports every branch of the U.S. armed forces. Each day, our employees do the can't be done by solving the most daunting challenges facing our customers. Visit peraton.com to learn how we're keeping people around the world safe and secure.

Responsibilities

Peraton requires an Enterprise Operations & Infrastructure Technical Lead Subject Matter Expert to support the Special Operation Command Information Technology Enterprise Contract (SITEC) - 3 Enterprise Operations and Maintenance (EOM) Task Order. The Enterprise Operations & Infrastructure Technical Lead works directly with the SITEC 3 EOM Enterprise Deputy Program Manager in executing requirements to meet and exceed performance objectives associated with the program. This position is located at MacDill AFB, FL.

The purpose of the Special Operations Forces Information Technology Enterprise Contract (SITEC) 3 Enterprise Operations and Maintenance (EOM) Task Order (TO) is to provide USSOCOM, its Component Commands, its Theater Special Operations Commands (TSOCs), and its deployed forces with Operations and Maintenance (O&M) services to maintain Network Operations (NetOps); maintain systems and network infrastructure; provide end user and common device support; provide configuration, change, license, and asset management; conduct training, and perform Install, Move, Add, Change (IMACs) services. The responsibilities and tasks associated with each requirement play a pivotal role to USSOCOM, the CIO/J6 organization, and ultimately the end-user who operate around the globe 24x7x365.

The Enterprise Operations & Infrastructure Technical Lead provides technical and operational support at the Subject Matter Expert level in executing SITEC 3 EOM requirements. The Enterprise Operations & Infrastructure Technical Lead must be detail-oriented and have in-depth knowledge of Enterprise IT Operations and Infrastructure and all aspects associated with delivering Enterprise- wide IT Operations and Infrastructure support, serving clients operating in both CONUS and OCONUS locations. The Enterprise Operations & Infrastructure Technical Lead assist the Enterprise DPM with managing and coordinating the information systems, technical innovation, leading Enterprise service delivery and championing industry best-fit solutions to advance the organization's enterprise infrastructure in support of the SIE. The Enterprise Operations & Infrastructure Technical Lead monitors and manages all IT infrastructure projects, coordinates across USSOCOM and Enterprise directorates, and executes to meet the client's ever-changing Enterprise IT needs. As the Enterprise Operations & Infrastructure Technical Lead, you will assist in determining current and future enterprise infrastructure requirements, ensuring the scalability of infrastructure from design to deployment required to delivery overall Enterprise IT excellence. You will assist in the development of policies and procedures to maintain, enhance, and secure the command's technology infrastructure.

Duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to:

 Support leading a dynamic, diverse technical team for secure Enterprise IT Operations delivery. Monitoring and managing operational status of the SIE to ensure the highest level of infrastructure performance. Assist in design, development, and deployment of Enterprise network operations, including but not limited to, systems and infrastructure architecture and engineering, interface planning, software and hardware resource availability, and the development of new applications. Provide strategic and technical support decisions, providing in-depth expertise that enable

operational impact across the SIE and align with, and support of, shaping the Commander's Enterprise IT budget over the course of the contract.

 Capable of resolving escalated issues arising from operations and frequent coordination with

associated Enterprise Divisions, Branches and Departments.

Location:

MacDill AFB, Florida

Qualifications

Minimum of 16 years with BS/BA; Minimum of 14 years with MS/MA; Minimum of 10 years with Ph.D.

Required qualifications:

 A DoD Top Secret security clearance is required for this position. BA with 16 years of experience, A Master's degree with 14 years of experience, or a PHD with 10 years of experience. A degree from an accredited college or university in Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering, a Mathematics-intensive discipline, or a similar field is preferred. Significant relevant experience will be considered in lieu of formal education. 14 years of increasingly complex and progressive experience in IT operations and

infrastructure including five years of specialized experience related to the candidate's assigned task.

 Minimum of 10-years of hands-on technical and operational experience leading, managing,

and operating at Enterprise-wide level, including demonstrative large-scale, complex computing environments, and consistently performing excellent service delivery at-scale

 Strong technical writing expertise with illustrated capability at the senior leadership level Proven experience briefing senior leadership and performance-driven outcomes. Demonstrated high-level capability of technical and operational service management experience such as leading ITSM platforms, Enterprise Orchestration tools, and/or SCRM DoDD 8570.01-M IAT Level III certification ITIL certification at the intermediate/practitioner level

Target Salary Range

SCA / Union / Intern Rate or Range

EEO

An Equal Opportunity Employer including Disability/Veteran.

Our Values

Benefits

At Peraton, our benefits are designed to help keep you at your best beyond the work you do with us daily. We're fully committed to the growth of our employees. From fully comprehensive medical plans to tuition reimbursement, tuition assistance, and fertility treatment, we are there to support you all the way.

Paid Time-Off and HolidaysRetirementLife & Disability InsuranceCareer DevelopmentTuition Assistance and Student Loan FinancingPaid Parental LeaveAdditional BenefitsMedical, Dental, & Vision Care

Experience Level (if available): None
